C++

Building a Simple Game Using 2D Vectors and C++

Information

This was meant to be our first real experience working inside of a game loop using an old in-house graphical library known as CORE. Through this, we were taught the basics of Linear Algebra, collision detection, and update/draw calls.

I enjoy looking back on this not due to the complexity of the code that I wrote, but due to the difficulty of learning how to code all of it. When I took the class (C++ II) at Neumont, our Professor had a very laissez faire teaching approach. He would give us a word doc of what he wanted for the assignment and would then only answer specific questions. We had to self teach ourselves how to actually achieve collision detection, etc.

I've debated going back and cleaning up the code in this codebase several times or working on a side project with CORE, but I've always decide against it. Its on the todo list, just not very high in priority.
